vectorData.altText: 10. Cerebellar outputs project to _________________ motor areas of the cerebral cortex. (ipsilateral / contralateral)
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.

Thatâ€™s right!  The cerebellar outputs project to the contralateral motor areas of the cerebral cortex. Remember, the ONLY contralateral input to the cerebellar hemisphere comes from motor planning area.

The cerebellum receives input from a number of sources, all ipsilateral, unless otherwise noted. 
The vestibular apparatus provides information regarding the static position of the head and its acceleration through space via the inferior cerebellar peduncle.
Proprioceptors in the face and body provide information regarding joint position, and therefore our position in space, predominantly via the inferior cerebellar peduncles. 
Visual and auditory input reaches the cerebellum from the superior and inferior colliculi, respectively, via the superior cerebellar peduncle. 
The only contralateral input to a given cerebellar hemisphere comes from motor planning areas of the contralateral cerebral hemispheres by way of the contralateral pontine nuclei. These pontocerebellar fibres constitute the whole of the middle cerebellar peduncle. Corticopontocerebellar     input includes information regarding voluntary movement that is being planned or that is ongoing. 
What does the cerebellum do with all this information?
It Coordinates Balance, Posture & Stereotyped Mvts
It Coordinates Skilled Voluntary Movements
Remember: the names of pathways are your friends! They tell you the flow of information.
